qas.question: What was amended to provide more office space in downtown?
What height was the original restriction in downtown for ?
How tall was the first office building to be approved in the on Water Street between Bishop's Cove and Steer's Cove?
What kind of space is abundant downtown?
Who decreased height restrictions from 15 meters to 12 meters?

plausible_answers.text: office building, which includes retail space and a parking garage

qas.question: What was the first 12 meter building to go into the area?

context: To meet the need for more <b3_0>office space<b3_0/> downtown without compromising the city's heritage, <b4_0>the city council<b4_0/> amended <a0_0>heritage regulations<a0_0/>, which originally restricted height to <a1_0>15 metres<a1_0/> in the area of land on Water Street between Bishop's Cove and Steer's Cove, to create the "Commercial Central Retail – West Zone". The new zone will allow for buildings of greater height. A <a2_0>47-metre<a2_0/>, 12-storey <b5_0>office building, which includes retail space and a parking garage<b5_0/>, was the first building to be approved in this area.
